abstract: Twitter executives, reporting quarterly results, acknowledge that vast majority of public does not understand social network or why they would use it, major obstacle to company's growth and one co-founder and interim chief Jack Dorsey pledges to change; company reports second-quarter profit of $49 million on revenue of $502 million, up from revenue of $312 million in year-earlier period; results exceed analyst expectations but shares fall by as much as 11 percent following candid assessment.
lead_paragraph: Shares fell after the company’s executives warned that the social network was still too hard to use and that it would take time to address the issue.

headline.main: Twitter Revenue Up 61%, but User Growth Lags
headline.print_headline: At Twitter, Slow Growth in New Users Disappoints

snippet: Shares fell after the company’s executives warned that the social network was still too hard to use and that it would take time to address the issue.
